title: Manage Applications
subtitle: Create and manage applications for your DreamFactory instance

types.none: No Storage Required - remote device, client, or desktop.
types.file: On a provisioned file storage service.

delete.confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this app?

applicationName.label: Application Name
applicationName.tooltip: The display name or label for your app, seen by users of the app in the LaunchPad UI.

description.label: Description
description.tooltip: The app description, seen by users of the app in the LaunchPad UI.

defaultRole.label: Assign a Default Role
defaultRole.tooltip: Unauthenticated or guest users of the app will have this role.

apiKey.label: The API key for this app is

appLocation.label: App Location
appLocation.tooltip: Select File Storage if you want to store your app code on your DreamFactory instance or some other remote file storage. Select Native for native apps or running the app from code on your local machine (CORS required). Select URL to specify a URL for your app.

options.noStorage: No Storage Required - remote device, client, or desktop.

fileStorage.label: On a provisioned file storage service.

storageService.label: Storage Service
storageService.tooltip: Where to store the files for your app.

storageFolder.label: Storage Folder
storageFolder.tooltip: The folder on the selected storage service.

launchPath.label: Launch Path
launchPath.tooltip: The is the file to load when your app is run. Default is index.html.
launchPath.placeholder: Enter default path and file to launch.

pathToApp.label: Path to Application
pathToApp.tooltip: The is the file to load when your app is run. Default is index.html.

url.label: URL to Application
url.tooltip: Applications can consist of only a URL. This could be an app on some other server or a web site URL.

urlPath.label: The URL for this app is:

import.title: Import Application
import.subtitle: Select App Package File
import.description: Select one of the sample apps below, enter the URL for a package file, or browse for a local package file. Click 'Import' to add the app to your DreamFactory instance.
